reviewText: Someone please tell me why this title isn't available on DVD format???My children and I loved this movie! A great whacky, adventure,musical/comedy!I can still remember the original, classic Donny & Marie show from the '70's. This movie is full of the same humor; so if you want a taste of nostalgia, and want a feel-good movie, with feel-good music, and whacky humor, I strongly recomend "Goin' Coconuts"!

reviewText: I am a die-hard Osmond Family fan.  Although there are pieces that are cheesy, if you are looking for a wholesome movie this is one of them.  Good movie for Osmond fans.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's worth having and it's worth watching. It features Donny and Marie just as you remember them from "The Donny and Marie" show.Both turn in good acting jobs. Donny is greatly loveable, just like always, and Marie is cute.The story and dialog, etc, are good and enjoyable. Some of the supporting actors are well known and add to the show.I wish the movie had more performance, and that's why I only give it 3 stars. You get only three almost full length performances. The movie opens with about a 2 minute song of typical Donny and Marie song and dance material. In the middle you get maybe a 2-3 minute solo performance by Donny on the piano, with cutsey mugging by Marie. At the end you get a great 5-10 minute production number of the Hawaiian war chant, featuring some vigorous, surprising, and very good Donny dancing, Marie doing a kind of juggling trick, Donny singing the lyric in Hawaiian, and Marie hula dancing, all great stuff. You have also heard this song in the "Enchanted Tiki Room" at Disneyland and you've seen Miss Piggy, Animal, Pigs and Penguins perform it on the Muppet Show.If you like Donny & Marie, it's certainly worth your time.Some reviewers have mentioned "corny." So what's wrong with that? Corn done well is a staple of entertainment. The "Marx Brothers" are corny, "The Munsters" is corny, the "Addams Family" is corny, "Get Smart" is way corny. "Hee Haw" did many straight seasons of nothing but corn.  And those are all great and greatly loved shows, so obviously it's entertaining on some level. I can allow that this show may be corny in parts, but I found it fun and even funny.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There was a saying where I grew up in the suburbs of Provo (outside of Salt Lk, and YES, hip deep in the 70's): Our parents would always start calling us inside from our intense kickball and big wheel activites when  Donnie & Marie  came on. Naturally we assumed it was mandatory viewing  because we lived in practically Mormon-central. So our end of week goodbyes  to each other went, "Uh-oh. MMV, see ya tomorrow". If memory  serves, this movie did better than Star Wars and the Muppet Movie in Utah.  Seemed that way. Anywho, enjoy much wacky shenanigans and zany capers with  America's beloved icons of orthidontics. (Complete with bungling crooks and  motorcycle chase). Also, I think some of the people involved with "The  Harlem Globetrotters On Gilligan's Island" were involved. I don't  know. I have to go lay down...
Title: N/A

reviewText: A friend of mine gave me "Goin' Coconuts" as a gag gift several years ago.  The joke was definitely on me.  This film is replete with hammy acting, insipid attempts at humor, and villains so inept it hurts to watch.  If you like the singing of Donny & Marie Osmond (I don't), that is about the only saving grace of this mess.Okay for the "goody two-shoes" crowd, but otherwise a pathetic attempt at entertainment.  Now I've gotta go watch some paint dry.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is actually a very enjoyable film, with Kenneth Mars turning in a VERY funny performance.Donny and Marie Osmond are such wonderful musical talents, I only wish the film had incorporated more of them singing.It's a lot like the old Elvis movies.  It's just fun to watch!I only wish this would be released on DVD...
summary: Kenneth Mars is hysterical!  A very charming film.
